I062/010.item definition: Identification of the system sending the data

subfields.note: The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix) .

I062/015.item definition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.

subfields.note: the service identification is allocated by the system

I062/060.item definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

subfields.subfield info: V G CH 0 A4 A2 A1 B4 B2 B1 C4 C2 C1 D4 D2 D1

I062/070.item definition: Absolute time stamping of the information provided in the track message, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.

subfields.note: S 1. This is the time of the track state vector. 2. The time is reset to zero at every midnight.

options: SPI present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

data.name2: Source of calculated track altitude for I062/130

subfields.subfield info: MON SPI MRH SRC CNF FX

options: last message transmitted to the user for the track
first message transmitted to the user for the track
ADS-B data inconsistent with other surveillance information
track not resulting from amalgamation process
Military Emergency present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Military Identification present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Age of the last received track update is higher than system dependent threshold (coasting)
Age of the last received PSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received SSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received Mode S track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received ADS-B track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Special Used Code (Mode A codes to be defined in the system to mark a track with special interest)
Assigned Mode A Code Conflict (same discrete Mode A Code assigned to another track)

subfields.note: S 1. Track type and coasting can also be derived from I062/290 System Track Update Ages 2. If the system supports the technology, default value 0 means that the technology was used to produce the report 3. If the system does not support the technology, default value is meaningless. I062/080 Track Status

options: Track created / updated with FPL data

subfields.note: Bits 6/4 (EMS) : other than subfield ,11 of data item I062/380, these bits allow the SDPS to set the emergency indication as derived from other sources than ADS-B (e.g. based on the Mode 3/A code) . NOTE - Bit 3 (PFT) : with this flag an SDPS can indicate that internal processing points to the track being potentially false. Details on the internal processing are system dependent. NOTE - Bit 2 (FPLT) : this bit - if set - indicates that the information contained in the target report has been updated by flight plan related data because no surveillance data was available for the target, or was created based on flight plan related data in areas with no surveillance. I062/080 Track Status

options: Duplicate Flight Plan due to manual correlation

subfields.note: S 1. Bit 8 (DUPT) is set to 1 if the correlation between the target report and a flight plan is not possible because the Mode 3/A code stated in the flight plan exists more than once in the surveillance data. 2. Bit 7 (DUPF) - if set to 1 - indicates that for a specific surveillance target more than one flight plan exists which makes correlation impossible. 3. Bit 6 (DUPM) is set to 1 if a target was correlated manually but also a regular flight plan exists. 4. All tracks for which bits 8, 7 or 6 are set to 1 are marked on the CWP.

I062/100.item definition: Calculated position in Cartesian co-ordinates with a resolution of 0.5m, in two’s complement form.

I062/105.item definition: Calculated Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates with a resolution of 180/225 . degrees

subfields.note: The LSB provides a resolution at least better than 0.6m.
subfields.subfield info: Latitude in WGS - 84 LSB Longitude in WGS - 84 LSB

I062/110.item definition: Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code
I062/110.item name: Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code

options: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude from Mode 5 reply

data.name2: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report
options: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received

subfields.note: S 1. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data items I062/120 , I062/060 and I062/135 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of the Subfield ,5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation) . 2. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Emergency bit set, then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set. 3. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Identification of Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set. Item I062/110 Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code

The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5 position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined formats. Item I062/110 Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code

S 1. GA is coded as a 14-bit two’s complement binary number with an LSB of 25 ft. irrespective of the setting of RES. 2. The minimum value of GA that can be reported is -1000 ft. Item I062/110 Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code

If Subfield ,1 is present, the M1 bit in Subfield ,1 indicates whether the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subfield ,1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply. Item I062/110 Mode 5 Data reports & Extended Mode 1 Code

data.name2: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report
options: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

I062/120.item definition: Mode 2 code associated to the track

subfields.subfield info: 0 0 0 0 A4 A2 A1 B4 B2 B1 C4 C2 C1 D4 D2 D1

I062/130.item definition: Vertical distance between the target and the projection of its position on the earth’s ellipsoid, as defined by WGS84, in two’s complement form.

subfields.note: S 1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO 2. The source of altitude is identified in bits (SRC) of item I062/080 Track Status

I062/135.item definition: Calculated Barometric Altitude of the track, in two’s complement form.

subfields.note: ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C
subfields.subfield info: QNH Calculated Track Barometric Altitude LSB

I062/136.item definition: Last valid and credible flight level used to update the track, in two’s complement form,.

subfields.note: S 1. The criteria to determine the credibility of the flight level are Tracker dependent. 2. Credible means: within reasonable range of change with respect to the previous detection. 3. ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C 4. This item includes the barometric altitude received from ADS-B

I062/185.item definition: Calculated track velocity expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two’s complement form.

subfields.note: The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target.

I062/200.item definition: Calculated Mode of Movement of a target.

subfields.note: The ADF, if set,  indicates that a difference has been detected in the altitude information derived from radar as compared to other technologies (such as ADS-B) .

I062/210.item definition: Calculated Acceleration of the target expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two’s complement form.

subfields.note: S 1. The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target. 2. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

I062/220.item definition: Calculated rate of Climb/Descent of an aircraft in two’s complement form.

subfields.note: A positive value indicates a climb, whereas a negative value indicates a descent.

I062/245.item definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.

options: Callsign or registration downlinked from target

data.name1: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification

subfields.note: S 1. For coding, see section 3.1.2.9 of (Ref.3) 2. As the Callsign of the target can already be transmitted (thanks to I062/380 Subfield ,2 if downlinked from the aircraft or thanks to I062/390 Subfield ,2 if the target is correlated to a flight plan) , and in order to avoid confusion at end user’s side, this item SHALL not be used.

I062/270.item definition: Target size defined as length and width of the detected target, and orientation.

subfields.note: S 1. The orientation gives the direction which the target nose is pointing to, relative to the Geographical North. 2. When the length only is sent, the largest dimension is provided.

I062/290.item definition: Ages of the last plot/local track/target report update for each sensor type.

subfields.note: S 1. Except for Track Age, the ages are counted from Data Item I062/070 ,  Time Of Track Information, using the following formula: Age = Time of track information - Time of last detection used to update the track 2. The time of last detection is derived from monosensor category time of day 3. If the data has never been received, then the corresponding subfield is not sent. 4. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

Despite there are now two subfields (,29 and ,30) reporting the ages of, respectively, the Indicated Airspeed track data and the Mach Number track data, this former subfield is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented.
In all the subfields, the age is the time delay since the value was measured

I062/340.item definition: All measured data related to the last report used to update the track. These data are not used for ADS-B.

subfields.note: The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int) .

The measured position is : 1. In case of a plot, the measured bias-corrected polar co- ordinates; 2. In case of a sensor local track, the measured bias-corrected polar co-ordinates of the plot associated to the track; 3. In case of a local track without detection, the extrapolated bias- corrected polar co-ordinates.

options: MODE 3/A code as derived from the reply of the transponder,
Smoothed MODE 3/A code as provided by a sensor local tracker.

subfields.note: Smoothed MODE 3/A data (L = 1) will be used in case of absence of MODE 3/A code information in the plot or in case of difference between plot and sensor local track MODE 3/A code information.

I062/380.item definition: Data derived directly by the aircraft.

data.name1: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining a target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available. Coding rules are provided in 3 Section 3.1.2.9.1.2 and Table 3-9

subfields.note: Despite there are now two subfields (,26 and ,27) reporting, respectively, the Indicated Airspeed track data and the Mach Number track data, this former subfield is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented.

options: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

subfields.note: S 1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data. 2. TCP numbers start from zero. 3. LT = Lateral Type 4. VT = Vertical Type 5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as the absolute time from midnight. 6. TOV is meaningful only if TOA is set to 0
subfields.subfield info: Format: Repetitive Data Item starting with a one-octet Field Repetition Indicator (REP) followed by at least one Trajectory Intent Point comprising fifteen octets

options: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM
No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
Transponder Ground Bit not set or unknown

subfields.note: Refer to ICAO Draft SARPs for ACAS for detailed explanations.
S 1. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn. 2. Value 15 means 15deg/s or above.
Velocity uncertainty category of the least accurate velocity component

options: highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knots cruise) 7 to
fixed ground or tethered obstruction 23 to

subfields.note: Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.
LSB) is required to be thinner than 10 ft by ICAO

subfields.subfield info: Format : Repetitive starting with an one-octet Field Repetition Indicator (REP) followed by at least one BDS report comprising one seven octet BDS register and one octet BDS code.

subfields.note: Only DAPs that can not be encoded into other subfields of this item should be sent using subfield ,25
BPS is the barometric pressure setting of the aircraft minus 800 mb.

I062/390.item definition: All flight plan related information, provided by ground-based systems.

subfields.note: The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int) .

Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Callsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

S 1. Each one of the four Octets composing the type of an aircraft contains an ASCII Character (upper-case alphanumeric characters with trailing spaces) . 2. The types of aircraft are defined in (Ref.4)

data.name2: Wake Turbulence Category is an ASCII character code which should be one of the following values : L = Light M = Medium H = Heavy J = “Super”

subfields.note: S 1. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic) . 2. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book.
S 1. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic) . 2. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book.
S 1. NU1, NU2 and LTR each contain an ASCII character 2. For details refer to.5 Section 5
The centre and the control position identification codes have to be defined between communication partners.
Estimated times are derived from flight plan systems. Predicted times are derived by the fusion system, based on surveillance data. For definitions, see (Ref.4)

Each one of the six Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Aircraft Stand identification is always left adjusted. It contains up to six upper- case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The SID is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The STAR is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.
S 1. This subfield is used only when the aircraft is transmitting an emergency Mode 3/A code 2. If VA = 0, the content of bits 12/1 is meaningless

S 1. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Callsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters 2. This subfield is used only when an emergency Mode 3/A is associated with the track (I062/390 Subfield ,17)
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
XY covariance component = sign {Cov(X,Y) } * sqrt {abs (Cov (X} 2. The maximum value for the (unsigned) XY covariance component is 16.383 km.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfields.subfield info: SYSTEM UNIT IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM TRACK NUMBER FX

subfields.note: The Field Reference Number ,2 is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented. In the above table  the first column indicates the Field Reference Number (FRN) associated to each Data Item used in the UAP;  the fourth column gives the format and the length of each item, a stand-alone figure indicates the octet-count of a fixed-length Data Item, 1+ indicates a variable-length Data Item comprising a first part of 1 octet
